2663  if (cell->line(e)->child(0)->vertex_index(1) == vertex)
2664  {
2665  adjacent_cells.insert(cell);
2666 
2667  // jump out of this tangle of nested loops
2668  goto next_cell;
2669  }
2670  }
2671 
2672  // in more than 3d we would probably have to do the same as
2673  // above also for even lower-dimensional objects
2674  Assert(dim <= 3, ExcNotImplemented());
2675 
2676  // move on to the next cell if we have found the
2677  // vertex on the current one
2678  next_cell:;
2679  }
2680 
2681  // if this was an active vertex then there needs to have been
2682  // at least one cell to which it is adjacent!
2683  Assert(adjacent_cells.size() > 0, ExcInternalError());
2684 
2685  // return the result as a vector, rather than the set we built above
2686  return std::vector<
2687  typename ::internal::
2688  ActiveCellIterator<dim, spacedim, MeshType<dim, spacedim>>::type>(
2689  adjacent_cells.begin(), adjacent_cells.end());
2690  }
2691 
2692 
2693 
2694  template <int dim, int spacedim>
2695  std::vector<std::vector<Tensor<1, spacedim>>>
2696  vertex_to_cell_centers_directions(
2697  const Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &mesh,
2698  const std::vector<
2699  std::set<typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator>>
2700  &vertex_to_cells)
2701  {
2702  const std::vector<Point<spacedim>> &vertices = mesh.get_vertices();
2703  const unsigned int n_vertices = vertex_to_cells.size();
2704 
2705  AssertDimension(vertices.size(), n_vertices);
2706 
2707 
2708  std::vector<std::vector<Tensor<1, spacedim>>> vertex_to_cell_centers(
2709  n_vertices);
2710  for (unsigned int vertex = 0; vertex < n_vertices; ++vertex)
2711  if (mesh.vertex_used(vertex))
2712  {
2713  const unsigned int n_neighbor_cells = vertex_to_cells[vertex].size();
2714  vertex_to_cell_centers[vertex].resize(n_neighbor_cells);
2715 
2716  typename std::set<typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::
2717  active_cell_iterator>::iterator it =
2718  vertex_to_cells[vertex].begin();
2719  for (unsigned int cell = 0; cell < n_neighbor_cells; ++cell, ++it)
2720  {
2721  vertex_to_cell_centers[vertex][cell] =
2722  (*it)->center() - vertices[vertex];
2723  vertex_to_cell_centers[vertex][cell] /=
2724  vertex_to_cell_centers[vertex][cell].norm();
2725  }
2726  }
2727  return vertex_to_cell_centers;
2728  }
2729 
2730 
2731  namespace internal
2732  {
2733  template <int spacedim>
2734  bool
2735  compare_point_association(
2736  const unsigned int a,
2737  const unsigned int b,
2738  const Tensor<1, spacedim> & point_direction,
2739  const std::vector<Tensor<1, spacedim>> &center_directions)
2740  {
2741  const double scalar_product_a = center_directions[a] * point_direction;
2742  const double scalar_product_b = center_directions[b] * point_direction;
2743 
2744  // The function is supposed to return if a is before b. We are looking
2745  // for the alignment of point direction and center direction, therefore
2746  // return if the scalar product of a is larger.
2747  return (scalar_product_a > scalar_product_b);
2748  }
2749 
2750 
2751 
2752  boost::geometry::model::point<double, 1, boost::geometry::cs::cartesian>
2753  create_boost_point(const Point<1> &p)
2754  {
2755  return boost::geometry::model::
2756  point<double, 1, boost::geometry::cs::cartesian>(p[0]);
2757  }
2758 
2759  boost::geometry::model::point<double, 2, boost::geometry::cs::cartesian>
2760  create_boost_point(const Point<2> &p)
2761  {
2762  return {p[0], p[1]};
2763  }
2764 
2765  boost::geometry::model::point<double, 3, boost::geometry::cs::cartesian>
2766  create_boost_point(const Point<3> &p)
2767  {
2768  return {p[0], p[1], p[2]};
2769  }
2770 
2771 
2772  } // namespace internal
2773 
2774  template <int dim, template <int, int> class MeshType, int spacedim>
2775 #ifndef _MSC_VER
2776  std::pair<typename MeshType<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator, Point<dim>>
2777 #else
2778  std::pair<typename ::internal::
2779  ActiveCellIterator<dim, spacedim, MeshType<dim, spacedim>>::type,
2780  Point<dim>>
2781 #endif
2782  find_active_cell_around_point(
2783  const Mapping<dim, spacedim> & mapping,
2784  const MeshType<dim, spacedim> &mesh,
2785  const Point<spacedim> & p,
2786  const std::vector<
2787  std::set<typename MeshType<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator>>
2788  & vertex_to_cells,
2789  const std::vector<std::vector<Tensor<1, spacedim>>> &vertex_to_cell_centers,
2790  const typename MeshType<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator &cell_hint,
2791  const std::vector<bool> & marked_vertices,
2792  const RTree<std::pair<Point<spacedim>, unsigned int>> &used_vertices_rtree,
2793  const double tolerance,
2794  const RTree<
2795  std::pair<BoundingBox<spacedim>,
2796  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator>>
2797  *relevant_cell_bounding_boxes_rtree)
2798  {
2799  std::pair<typename MeshType<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator,
2800  Point<dim>>
2801  cell_and_position;
2802  // To handle points at the border we keep track of points which are close to
2803  // the unit cell:
2804  std::pair<typename MeshType<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator,
2805  Point<dim>>
2806  cell_and_position_approx;
2807 
2808  if (relevant_cell_bounding_boxes_rtree != nullptr &&
2809  !relevant_cell_bounding_boxes_rtree->empty())
2810  {
2811  if (relevant_cell_bounding_boxes_rtree->qbegin(
2812  boost::geometry::index::intersects(internal::create_boost_point(
2813  p))) == relevant_cell_bounding_boxes_rtree->qend())
2814  return cell_and_position;
2815  }
2816 
2817  bool found_cell = false;
2818  bool approx_cell = false;
2819 
2820  unsigned int closest_vertex_index = 0;
2821  Tensor<1, spacedim> vertex_to_point;
2822  auto current_cell = cell_hint;
2823 
2824  while (found_cell == false)
2825  {
2826  // First look at the vertices of the cell cell_hint. If it's an
2827  // invalid cell, then query for the closest global vertex
2828  if (current_cell.state() == IteratorState::valid)
2829  {
2830  const auto cell_vertices = mapping.get_vertices(current_cell);
2831  const unsigned int closest_vertex =
2832  find_closest_vertex_of_cell<dim, spacedim>(current_cell,
2833  p,
2834  mapping);
2835  vertex_to_point = p - cell_vertices[closest_vertex];
2836  closest_vertex_index = current_cell->vertex_index(closest_vertex);
2837  }
2838  else
2839  {
2840  if (!used_vertices_rtree.empty())
2841  {
2842  // If we have an rtree at our disposal, use it.
2843  using ValueType = std::pair<Point<spacedim>, unsigned int>;
2844  std::function<bool(const ValueType &)> marked;
2845  if (marked_vertices.size() == mesh.n_vertices())
2846  marked = [&marked_vertices](const ValueType &value) -> bool {
2847  return marked_vertices[value.second];
2848  };
2849  else
2850  marked = [](const ValueType &) -> bool { return true; };
2851 
2852  std::vector<std::pair<Point<spacedim>, unsigned int>> res;
2853  used_vertices_rtree.query(
2854  boost::geometry::index::nearest(p, 1) &&
2855  boost::geometry::index::satisfies(marked),
2856  std::back_inserter(res));
2857 
2858  // We should have one and only one result
2859  AssertDimension(res.size(), 1);
2860  closest_vertex_index = res[0].second;
2861  }
2862  else
2863  {
2864  closest_vertex_index = GridTools::find_closest_vertex(
2865  mapping, mesh, p, marked_vertices);
2866  }
2867  vertex_to_point = p - mesh.get_vertices()[closest_vertex_index];
2868  }
2869 
2870  const double vertex_point_norm = vertex_to_point.norm();
2871  if (vertex_point_norm > 0)
2872  vertex_to_point /= vertex_point_norm;
2873 
2874  const unsigned int n_neighbor_cells =
2875  vertex_to_cells[closest_vertex_index].size();
2876 
2877  // Create a corresponding map of vectors from vertex to cell center
2878  std::vector<unsigned int> neighbor_permutation(n_neighbor_cells);
2879 
2880  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < n_neighbor_cells; ++i)
2881  neighbor_permutation[i] = i;
2882 
2883  auto comp = [&](const unsigned int a, const unsigned int b) -> bool {
2884  return internal::compare_point_association<spacedim>(
2885  a,
2886  b,
2887  vertex_to_point,
2888  vertex_to_cell_centers[closest_vertex_index]);
2889  };
2890 
2891  std::sort(neighbor_permutation.begin(),
2892  neighbor_permutation.end(),
2893  comp);
2894  // It is possible the vertex is close
2895  // to an edge, thus we add a tolerance
2896  // to keep also the "best" cell
2897  double best_distance = tolerance;
2898 
2899  // Search all of the cells adjacent to the closest vertex of the cell
2900  // hint Most likely we will find the point in them.
2901  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < n_neighbor_cells; ++i)
2902  {
2903  try
2904  {
2905  auto cell = vertex_to_cells[closest_vertex_index].begin();
2906  std::advance(cell, neighbor_permutation[i]);
2907 
2908  if (!(*cell)->is_artificial())
2909  {
2910  const Point<dim> p_unit =
2911  mapping.transform_real_to_unit_cell(*cell, p);
2912  if (GeometryInfo<dim>::is_inside_unit_cell(p_unit,
2913  tolerance))
2914  {
2915  cell_and_position.first = *cell;
2916  cell_and_position.second = p_unit;
2917  found_cell = true;
2918  approx_cell = false;
2919  break;
2920  }
2921  // The point is not inside this cell: checking how far
2922  // outside it is and whether we want to use this cell as a
2923  // backup if we can't find a cell within which the point
2924  // lies.
2925  const double dist =
2926  GeometryInfo<dim>::distance_to_unit_cell(p_unit);
2927  if (dist < best_distance)
2928  {
2929  best_distance = dist;
2930  cell_and_position_approx.first = *cell;
2931  cell_and_position_approx.second = p_unit;
2932  approx_cell = true;
2933  }
2934  }
2935  }
2936  catch (typename Mapping<dim>::ExcTransformationFailed &)
2937  {}
2938  }
2939 
2940  if (found_cell == true)
2941  return cell_and_position;
2942  else if (approx_cell == true)
2943  return cell_and_position_approx;
2944 
2945  // The first time around, we check for vertices in the hint_cell. If
2946  // that does not work, we set the cell iterator to an invalid one, and
2947  // look for a global vertex close to the point. If that does not work,
2948  // we are in trouble, and just throw an exception.
2949  //
2950  // If we got here, then we did not find the point. If the
2951  // current_cell.state() here is not IteratorState::valid, it means that
2952  // the user did not provide a hint_cell, and at the beginning of the
2953  // while loop we performed an actual global search on the mesh
2954  // vertices. Not finding the point then means the point is outside the
2955  // domain, or that we've had problems with the algorithm above. Try as a
2956  // last resort the other (simpler) algorithm.
2957  if (current_cell.state() != IteratorState::valid)
2958  return find_active_cell_around_point(
2959  mapping, mesh, p, marked_vertices, tolerance);
2960 
2961  current_cell = typename MeshType<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator();
2962  }
2963  return cell_and_position;
2964  }
2965 
2966 
2967 
2968  template <int dim, int spacedim>
2969  unsigned int
2970  find_closest_vertex_of_cell(
2971  const typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator &cell,
2972  const Point<spacedim> & position,
2973  const Mapping<dim, spacedim> & mapping)
2974  {
2975  const auto vertices = mapping.get_vertices(cell);
2976  double minimum_distance = position.distance_square(vertices[0]);
2977  unsigned int closest_vertex = 0;
2978 
2979  for (unsigned int v = 1; v < cell->n_vertices(); ++v)
2980  {
2981  const double vertex_distance = position.distance_square(vertices[v]);
2982  if (vertex_distance < minimum_distance)
2983  {
2984  closest_vertex = v;
2985  minimum_distance = vertex_distance;
2986  }
2987  }
2988  return closest_vertex;
2989  }
2990 
2991 
2992 
2993  namespace internal
2994  {
2995  namespace BoundingBoxPredicate
2996  {
2997  template <class MeshType>
2998  std::tuple<BoundingBox<MeshType::space_dimension>, bool>
2999  compute_cell_predicate_bounding_box(
3000  const typename MeshType::cell_iterator &parent_cell,
3001  const std::function<
3002  bool(const typename MeshType::active_cell_iterator &)> &predicate)
3003  {
3004  bool has_predicate =
3005  false; // Start assuming there's no cells with predicate inside
3006  std::vector<typename MeshType::active_cell_iterator> active_cells;
3007  if (parent_cell->is_active())
3008  active_cells = {parent_cell};
3009  else
3010  // Finding all active cells descendants of the current one (or the
3011  // current one if it is active)
3012  active_cells = get_active_child_cells<MeshType>(parent_cell);
3013 
3014  const unsigned int spacedim = MeshType::space_dimension;
3015 
3016  // Looking for the first active cell which has the property predicate
3017  unsigned int i = 0;
3018  while (i < active_cells.size() && !predicate(active_cells[i]))
3019  ++i;
3020 
3021  // No active cells or no active cells with property
3022  if (active_cells.size() == 0 || i == active_cells.size())
3023  {
3024  BoundingBox<spacedim> bbox;
3025  return std::make_tuple(bbox, has_predicate);
3026  }
3027 
3028  // The two boundary points defining the boundary box
3029  Point<spacedim> maxp = active_cells[i]->vertex(0);
3030  Point<spacedim> minp = active_cells[i]->vertex(0);
3031 
3032  for (; i < active_cells.size(); ++i)
3033  if (predicate(active_cells[i]))
3034  for (const unsigned int v : active_cells[i]->vertex_indices())
3035  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < spacedim; ++d)
3036  {
3037  minp[d] = std::min(minp[d], active_cells[i]->vertex(v)[d]);
3038  maxp[d] = std::max(maxp[d], active_cells[i]->vertex(v)[d]);
3039  }
3040 
3041  has_predicate = true;
3042  BoundingBox<spacedim> bbox(std::make_pair(minp, maxp));
3043  return std::make_tuple(bbox, has_predicate);
3044  }
3045  } // namespace BoundingBoxPredicate
3046  } // namespace internal
3047 
3048 
3049 
3050  template <class MeshType>
3051  std::vector<BoundingBox<MeshType::space_dimension>>
3052  compute_mesh_predicate_bounding_box(
3053  const MeshType &mesh,
3054  const std::function<bool(const typename MeshType::active_cell_iterator &)>
3055  & predicate,
3056  const unsigned int refinement_level,
3057  const bool allow_merge,
3058  const unsigned int max_boxes)
3059  {
3060  // Algorithm brief description: begin with creating bounding boxes of all
3061  // cells at refinement_level (and coarser levels if there are active cells)
3062  // which have the predicate property. These are then merged
3063 
3064  Assert(
3065  refinement_level <= mesh.n_levels(),
3066  ExcMessage(
3067  "Error: refinement level is higher then total levels in the triangulation!"));
3068 
3069  const unsigned int spacedim = MeshType::space_dimension;
3070  std::vector<BoundingBox<spacedim>> bounding_boxes;
3071 
3072  // Creating a bounding box for all active cell on coarser level
3073 
3074  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < refinement_level; ++i)
3075  for (const typename MeshType::cell_iterator &cell :
3076  mesh.active_cell_iterators_on_level(i))
3077  {
3078  bool has_predicate = false;
3079  BoundingBox<spacedim> bbox;
3080  std::tie(bbox, has_predicate) =
3081  internal::BoundingBoxPredicate::compute_cell_predicate_bounding_box<
3082  MeshType>(cell, predicate);
3083  if (has_predicate)
3084  bounding_boxes.push_back(bbox);
3085  }
3086 
3087  // Creating a Bounding Box for all cells on the chosen refinement_level
3088  for (const typename MeshType::cell_iterator &cell :
3089  mesh.cell_iterators_on_level(refinement_level))
3090  {
3091  bool has_predicate = false;
3092  BoundingBox<spacedim> bbox;
3093  std::tie(bbox, has_predicate) =
3094  internal::BoundingBoxPredicate::compute_cell_predicate_bounding_box<
3095  MeshType>(cell, predicate);
3096  if (has_predicate)
3097  bounding_boxes.push_back(bbox);
3098  }
3099 
3100  if (!allow_merge)
3101  // If merging is not requested return the created bounding_boxes
3102  return bounding_boxes;
3103  else
3104  {
3105  // Merging part of the algorithm
3106  // Part 1: merging neighbors
3107  // This array stores the indices of arrays we have already merged
3108  std::vector<unsigned int> merged_boxes_idx;
3109  bool found_neighbors = true;
3110 
3111  // We merge only neighbors which can be expressed by a single bounding
3112  // box e.g. in 1d [0,1] and [1,2] can be described with [0,2] without
3113  // losing anything
3114  while (found_neighbors)
3115  {
3116  found_neighbors = false;
3117  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < bounding_boxes.size() - 1; ++i)
3118  {
3119  if (std::find(merged_boxes_idx.begin(),
3120  merged_boxes_idx.end(),
3121  i) == merged_boxes_idx.end())
3122  for (unsigned int j = i + 1; j < bounding_boxes.size(); ++j)
3123  if (std::find(merged_boxes_idx.begin(),
3124  merged_boxes_idx.end(),
3125  j) == merged_boxes_idx.end() &&
3126  bounding_boxes[i].get_neighbor_type(
3127  bounding_boxes[j]) ==
3128  NeighborType::mergeable_neighbors)
3129  {
3130  bounding_boxes[i].merge_with(bounding_boxes[j]);
3131  merged_boxes_idx.push_back(j);
3132  found_neighbors = true;
3133  }
3134  }
3135  }
3136 
3137  // Copying the merged boxes into merged_b_boxes
3138  std::vector<BoundingBox<spacedim>> merged_b_boxes;
3139  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < bounding_boxes.size(); ++i)
3140  if (std::find(merged_boxes_idx.begin(), merged_boxes_idx.end(), i) ==
3141  merged_boxes_idx.end())
3142  merged_b_boxes.push_back(bounding_boxes[i]);
3143 
3144  // Part 2: if there are too many bounding boxes, merging smaller boxes
3145  // This has sense only in dimension 2 or greater, since in dimension 1,
3146  // neighboring intervals can always be merged without problems
3147  if ((merged_b_boxes.size() > max_boxes) && (spacedim > 1))
3148  {
3149  std::vector<double> volumes;
3150  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < merged_b_boxes.size(); ++i)
3151  volumes.push_back(merged_b_boxes[i].volume());
3152 
3153  while (merged_b_boxes.size() > max_boxes)
3154  {
3155  unsigned int min_idx =
3156  std::min_element(volumes.begin(), volumes.end()) -
3157  volumes.begin();
3158  volumes.erase(volumes.begin() + min_idx);
3159  // Finding a neighbor
3160  bool not_removed = true;
3161  for (unsigned int i = 0;
3162  i < merged_b_boxes.size() && not_removed;
3163  ++i)
3164  // We merge boxes if we have "attached" or "mergeable"
3165  // neighbors, even though mergeable should be dealt with in
3166  // Part 1
3167  if (i != min_idx && (merged_b_boxes[i].get_neighbor_type(
3168  merged_b_boxes[min_idx]) ==
3169  NeighborType::attached_neighbors ||
3170  merged_b_boxes[i].get_neighbor_type(
3171  merged_b_boxes[min_idx]) ==
3172  NeighborType::mergeable_neighbors))
3173  {
3174  merged_b_boxes[i].merge_with(merged_b_boxes[min_idx]);
3175  merged_b_boxes.erase(merged_b_boxes.begin() + min_idx);
3176  not_removed = false;
3177  }
3178  Assert(!not_removed,
3179  ExcMessage("Error: couldn't merge bounding boxes!"));
3180  }
3181  }
3182  Assert(merged_b_boxes.size() <= max_boxes,
3183  ExcMessage(
3184  "Error: couldn't reach target number of bounding boxes!"));
3185  return merged_b_boxes;
3186  }
3187  }
3188 
3189 
3190 
3191  template <int spacedim>
3192 #ifndef DOXYGEN
3193  std::tuple<std::vector<std::vector<unsigned int>>,
3194  std::map<unsigned int, unsigned int>,
3195  std::map<unsigned int, std::vector<unsigned int>>>
3196 #else
3197  return_type
3198 #endif
3199  guess_point_owner(
3200  const std::vector<std::vector<BoundingBox<spacedim>>> &global_bboxes,
3201  const std::vector<Point<spacedim>> & points)
3202  {
3203  unsigned int n_procs = global_bboxes.size();
3204  std::vector<std::vector<unsigned int>> point_owners(n_procs);
3205  std::map<unsigned int, unsigned int> map_owners_found;
3206  std::map<unsigned int, std::vector<unsigned int>> map_owners_guessed;
3207 
3208  unsigned int n_points = points.size();
3209  for (unsigned int pt = 0; pt < n_points; ++pt)
3210  {
3211  // Keep track of how many processes we guess to own the point
3212  std::vector<unsigned int> owners_found;
3213  // Check in which other processes the point might be
3214  for (unsigned int rk = 0; rk < n_procs; ++rk)
3215  {
3216  for (const BoundingBox<spacedim> &bbox : global_bboxes[rk])
3217  if (bbox.point_inside(points[pt]))
3218  {
3219  point_owners[rk].emplace_back(pt);
3220  owners_found.emplace_back(rk);
3221  break; // We can check now the next process
3222  }
3223  }
3224  Assert(owners_found.size() > 0,
3225  ExcMessage("No owners found for the point " +
3226  std::to_string(pt)));
3227  if (owners_found.size() == 1)
3228  map_owners_found[pt] = owners_found[0];
3229  else
3230  // Multiple owners
3231  map_owners_guessed[pt] = owners_found;
3232  }
3233 
3234  return std::make_tuple(std::move(point_owners),
3235  std::move(map_owners_found),
3236  std::move(map_owners_guessed));
3237  }
3238 
3239  template <int spacedim>
3240 #ifndef DOXYGEN
3241  std::tuple<std::map<unsigned int, std::vector<unsigned int>>,
3242  std::map<unsigned int, unsigned int>,
3243  std::map<unsigned int, std::vector<unsigned int>>>
3244 #else
3245  return_type
3246 #endif
3247  guess_point_owner(
3248  const RTree<std::pair<BoundingBox<spacedim>, unsigned int>> &covering_rtree,
3249  const std::vector<Point<spacedim>> & points)
3250  {
3251  std::map<unsigned int, std::vector<unsigned int>> point_owners;
3252  std::map<unsigned int, unsigned int> map_owners_found;
3253  std::map<unsigned int, std::vector<unsigned int>> map_owners_guessed;
3254  std::vector<std::pair<BoundingBox<spacedim>, unsigned int>> search_result;
3255 
3256  unsigned int n_points = points.size();
3257  for (unsigned int pt_n = 0; pt_n < n_points; ++pt_n)
3258  {
3259  search_result.clear(); // clearing last output
3260 
3261  // Running tree search
3262  covering_rtree.query(boost::geometry::index::intersects(points[pt_n]),
3263  std::back_inserter(search_result));
3264 
3265  // Keep track of how many processes we guess to own the point
3266  std::set<unsigned int> owners_found;
3267  // Check in which other processes the point might be
3268  for (const auto &rank_bbox : search_result)
3269  {
3270  // Try to add the owner to the owners found,
3271  // and check if it was already present
3272  const bool pt_inserted = owners_found.insert(pt_n).second;
3273  if (pt_inserted)
3274  point_owners[rank_bbox.second].emplace_back(pt_n);
3275  }
3276  Assert(owners_found.size() > 0,
3277  ExcMessage("No owners found for the point " +
3278  std::to_string(pt_n)));
3279  if (owners_found.size() == 1)
3280  map_owners_found[pt_n] = *owners_found.begin();
3281  else
3282  // Multiple owners
3283  std::copy(owners_found.begin(),
3284  owners_found.end(),
3285  std::back_inserter(map_owners_guessed[pt_n]));
3286  }
3287 
3288  return std::make_tuple(std::move(point_owners),
3289  std::move(map_owners_found),
3290  std::move(map_owners_guessed));
3291  }
3292 
3293 
3294  template <int dim, int spacedim>
3295  std::vector<
3296  std::set<typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator>>
3297  vertex_to_cell_map(const Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation)
3298  {
3299  std::vector<
3300  std::set<typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator>>
3301  vertex_to_cell_map(triangulation.n_vertices());
3302  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator
3303  cell = triangulation.begin_active(),
3304  endc = triangulation.end();
3305  for (; cell != endc; ++cell)
3306  for (const unsigned int i : cell->vertex_indices())
3307  vertex_to_cell_map[cell->vertex_index(i)].insert(cell);
3308 
3309  // Take care of hanging nodes
3310  cell = triangulation.begin_active();
3311  for (; cell != endc; ++cell)
3312  {
3313  for (unsigned int i : cell->face_indices())
3314  {
3315  if ((cell->at_boundary(i) == false) &&
3316  (cell->neighbor(i)->is_active()))
3317  {
3318  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator
3319  adjacent_cell = cell->neighbor(i);
3320  for (unsigned int j = 0; j < cell->face(i)->n_vertices(); ++j)
3321  vertex_to_cell_map[cell->face(i)->vertex_index(j)].insert(
3322  adjacent_cell);
3323  }
3324  }
3325 
3326  // in 3d also loop over the edges
3327  if (dim == 3)
3328  {
3329  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < cell->n_lines(); ++i)
3330  if (cell->line(i)->has_children())
3331  // the only place where this vertex could have been
3332  // hiding is on the mid-edge point of the edge we
3333  // are looking at
3334  vertex_to_cell_map[cell->line(i)->child(0)->vertex_index(1)]
3335  .insert(cell);
3336  }
3337  }
3338 
3339  return vertex_to_cell_map;
3340  }
3341 
3342 
3343 
3344  template <int dim, int spacedim>
3345  std::map<unsigned int, types::global_vertex_index>
3346  compute_local_to_global_vertex_index_map(
3347  const parallel::distributed::Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation)
3348  {
3349  std::map<unsigned int, types::global_vertex_index>
3350  local_to_global_vertex_index;
3351 
3352 #ifndef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
3353 
3354  // without MPI, this function doesn't make sense because on cannot
3355  // use parallel::distributed::Triangulation in any meaningful
3356  // way
3357  (void)triangulation;
3358  Assert(false,
3359  ExcMessage("This function does not make any sense "
3360  "for parallel::distributed::Triangulation "
3361  "objects if you do not have MPI enabled."));
3362 
3363 #else
3364 
3365  using active_cell_iterator =
3366  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator;
3367  const std::vector<std::set<active_cell_iterator>> vertex_to_cell =
3368  vertex_to_cell_map(triangulation);
3369 
3370  // Create a local index for the locally "owned" vertices
3371  types::global_vertex_index next_index = 0;
3372  unsigned int max_cellid_size = 0;
3373  std::set<std::pair<types::subdomain_id, types::global_vertex_index>>
3374  vertices_added;
3375  std::map<types::subdomain_id, std::set<unsigned int>> vertices_to_recv;
3376  std::map<types::subdomain_id,
3377  std::vector<std::tuple<types::global_vertex_index,
3378  types::global_vertex_index,
3379  std::string>>>
3380  vertices_to_send;
3381  active_cell_iterator cell = triangulation.begin_active(),
3382  endc = triangulation.end();
3383  std::set<active_cell_iterator> missing_vert_cells;
3384  std::set<unsigned int> used_vertex_index;
3385  for (; cell != endc; ++cell)
3386  {
3387  if (cell->is_locally_owned())
3388  {
3389  for (const unsigned int i : cell->vertex_indices())
3390  {
3391  types::subdomain_id lowest_subdomain_id = cell->subdomain_id();
3392  typename std::set<active_cell_iterator>::iterator
3393  adjacent_cell = vertex_to_cell[cell->vertex_index(i)].begin(),
3394  end_adj_cell = vertex_to_cell[cell->vertex_index(i)].end();
3395  for (; adjacent_cell != end_adj_cell; ++adjacent_cell)
3396  lowest_subdomain_id =
3397  std::min(lowest_subdomain_id,
3398  (*adjacent_cell)->subdomain_id());
3399 
3400  // See if I "own" this vertex
3401  if (lowest_subdomain_id == cell->subdomain_id())
3402  {
3403  // Check that the vertex we are working on a vertex that has
3404  // not be dealt with yet
3405  if (used_vertex_index.find(cell->vertex_index(i)) ==
3406  used_vertex_index.end())
3407  {
3408  // Set the local index
3409  local_to_global_vertex_index[cell->vertex_index(i)] =
3410  next_index++;
3411 
3412  // Store the information that will be sent to the
3413  // adjacent cells on other subdomains
3414  adjacent_cell =
3415  vertex_to_cell[cell->vertex_index(i)].begin();
3416  for (; adjacent_cell != end_adj_cell; ++adjacent_cell)
3417  if ((*adjacent_cell)->subdomain_id() !=
3418  cell->subdomain_id())
3419  {
3420  std::pair<types::subdomain_id,
3421  types::global_vertex_index>
3422  tmp((*adjacent_cell)->subdomain_id(),
3423  cell->vertex_index(i));
3424  if (vertices_added.find(tmp) ==
3425  vertices_added.end())
3426  {
3427  vertices_to_send[(*adjacent_cell)
3428  ->subdomain_id()]
3429  .emplace_back(i,
3430  cell->vertex_index(i),
3431  cell->id().to_string());
3432  if (cell->id().to_string().size() >
3433  max_cellid_size)
3434  max_cellid_size =
3435  cell->id().to_string().size();
3436  vertices_added.insert(tmp);
3437  }
3438  }
3439  used_vertex_index.insert(cell->vertex_index(i));
3440  }
3441  }
3442  else
3443  {
3444  // We don't own the vertex so we will receive its global
3445  // index
3446  vertices_to_recv[lowest_subdomain_id].insert(
3447  cell->vertex_index(i));
3448  missing_vert_cells.insert(cell);
3449  }
3450  }
3451  }
3452 
3453  // Some hanging nodes are vertices of ghost cells. They need to be
3454  // received.
3455  if (cell->is_ghost())
3456  {
3457  for (unsigned int i : cell->face_indices())
3458  {
3459  if (cell->at_boundary(i) == false)
3460  {
3461  if (cell->neighbor(i)->is_active())
3462  {
3463  typename Triangulation<dim,
3464  spacedim>::active_cell_iterator
3465  adjacent_cell = cell->neighbor(i);
3466  if ((adjacent_cell->is_locally_owned()))
3467  {
3468  types::subdomain_id adj_subdomain_id =
3469  adjacent_cell->subdomain_id();
3470  if (cell->subdomain_id() < adj_subdomain_id)
3471  for (unsigned int j = 0;
3472  j < cell->face(i)->n_vertices();
3473  ++j)
3474  {
3475  vertices_to_recv[cell->subdomain_id()].insert(
3476  cell->face(i)->vertex_index(j));
3477  missing_vert_cells.insert(cell);
3478  }
3479  }
3480  }
3481  }
3482  }
3483  }
3484  }
3485 
3486  // Get the size of the largest CellID string
3487  max_cellid_size =
3488  Utilities::MPI::max(max_cellid_size, triangulation.get_communicator());
3489 
3490  // Make indices global by getting the number of vertices owned by each
3491  // processors and shifting the indices accordingly
3492  types::global_vertex_index shift = 0;
3493  int ierr = MPI_Exscan(&next_index,
3494  &shift,
3495  1,
3496  DEAL_II_VERTEX_INDEX_MPI_TYPE,
3497  MPI_SUM,
3498  triangulation.get_communicator());
3499  AssertThrowMPI(ierr);
3500 
3501  std::map<unsigned int, types::global_vertex_index>::iterator
3502  global_index_it = local_to_global_vertex_index.begin(),
3503  global_index_end = local_to_global_vertex_index.end();
3504  for (; global_index_it != global_index_end; ++global_index_it)
3505  global_index_it->second += shift;
3506 
3507 
3508  const int mpi_tag = Utilities::MPI::internal::Tags::
3509  grid_tools_compute_local_to_global_vertex_index_map;
3510  const int mpi_tag2 = Utilities::MPI::internal::Tags::
3511  grid_tools_compute_local_to_global_vertex_index_map2;
3512 
3513 
3514  // In a first message, send the global ID of the vertices and the local
3515  // positions in the cells. In a second messages, send the cell ID as a
3516  // resize string. This is done in two messages so that types are not mixed
3517 
3518  // Send the first message
3519  std::vector<std::vector<types::global_vertex_index>> vertices_send_buffers(
3520  vertices_to_send.size());
3521  std::vector<MPI_Request> first_requests(vertices_to_send.size());
3522  typename std::map<types::subdomain_id,
3523  std::vector<std::tuple<types::global_vertex_index,
3524  types::global_vertex_index,
3525  std::string>>>::iterator
3526  vert_to_send_it = vertices_to_send.begin(),
3527  vert_to_send_end = vertices_to_send.end();
3528  for (unsigned int i = 0; vert_to_send_it != vert_to_send_end;
3529  ++vert_to_send_it, ++i)
3530  {
3531  int destination = vert_to_send_it->first;
3532  const unsigned int n_vertices = vert_to_send_it->second.size();
3533  const int buffer_size = 2 * n_vertices;
3534  vertices_send_buffers[i].resize(buffer_size);
3535 
3536  // fill the buffer
3537  for (unsigned int j = 0; j < n_vertices; ++j)
3538  {
3539  vertices_send_buffers[i][2 * j] =
3540  std::get<0>(vert_to_send_it->second[j]);
3541  vertices_send_buffers[i][2 * j + 1] =
3542  local_to_global_vertex_index[std::get<1>(
3543  vert_to_send_it->second[j])];
3544  }
3545 
3546  // Send the message
3547  ierr = MPI_Isend(vertices_send_buffers[i].data(),
3548  buffer_size,
3549  DEAL_II_VERTEX_INDEX_MPI_TYPE,
3550  destination,
3551  mpi_tag,
3552  triangulation.get_communicator(),
3553  &first_requests[i]);
3554  AssertThrowMPI(ierr);
3555  }
3556 
3557  // Receive the first message
3558  std::vector<std::vector<types::global_vertex_index>> vertices_recv_buffers(
3559  vertices_to_recv.size());
3560  typename std::map<types::subdomain_id, std::set<unsigned int>>::iterator
3561  vert_to_recv_it = vertices_to_recv.begin(),
3562  vert_to_recv_end = vertices_to_recv.end();
3563  for (unsigned int i = 0; vert_to_recv_it != vert_to_recv_end;
3564  ++vert_to_recv_it, ++i)
3565  {
3566  int source = vert_to_recv_it->first;
3567  const unsigned int n_vertices = vert_to_recv_it->second.size();
3568  const int buffer_size = 2 * n_vertices;
3569  vertices_recv_buffers[i].resize(buffer_size);
3570 
3571  // Receive the message
3572  ierr = MPI_Recv(vertices_recv_buffers[i].data(),
3573  buffer_size,
3574  DEAL_II_VERTEX_INDEX_MPI_TYPE,
3575  source,
3576  mpi_tag,
3577  triangulation.get_communicator(),
3578  MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
3579  AssertThrowMPI(ierr);
3580  }
3581 
3582 
3583  // Send second message
3584  std::vector<std::vector<char>> cellids_send_buffers(
3585  vertices_to_send.size());
3586  std::vector<MPI_Request> second_requests(vertices_to_send.size());
3587  vert_to_send_it = vertices_to_send.begin();
3588  for (unsigned int i = 0; vert_to_send_it != vert_to_send_end;
3589  ++vert_to_send_it, ++i)
3590  {
3591  int destination = vert_to_send_it->first;
3592  const unsigned int n_vertices = vert_to_send_it->second.size();
3593  const int buffer_size = max_cellid_size * n_vertices;
3594  cellids_send_buffers[i].resize(buffer_size);
3595 
3596  // fill the buffer
3597  unsigned int pos = 0;
3598  for (unsigned int j = 0; j < n_vertices; ++j)
3599  {
3600  std::string cell_id = std::get<2>(vert_to_send_it->second[j]);
3601  for (unsigned int k = 0; k < max_cellid_size; ++k, ++pos)
3602  {
3603  if (k < cell_id.size())
3604  cellids_send_buffers[i][pos] = cell_id[k];
3605  // if necessary fill up the reserved part of the buffer with an
3606  // invalid value
3607  else
3608  cellids_send_buffers[i][pos] = '-';
3609  }
3610  }
3611 
3612  // Send the message
3613  ierr = MPI_Isend(cellids_send_buffers[i].data(),
3614  buffer_size,
3615  MPI_CHAR,
3616  destination,
3617  mpi_tag2,
3618  triangulation.get_communicator(),
3619  &second_requests[i]);
3620  AssertThrowMPI(ierr);
3621  }
3622 
3623  // Receive the second message
3624  std::vector<std::vector<char>> cellids_recv_buffers(
3625  vertices_to_recv.size());
3626  vert_to_recv_it = vertices_to_recv.begin();
3627  for (unsigned int i = 0; vert_to_recv_it != vert_to_recv_end;
3628  ++vert_to_recv_it, ++i)
3629  {
3630  int source = vert_to_recv_it->first;
3631  const unsigned int n_vertices = vert_to_recv_it->second.size();
3632  const int buffer_size = max_cellid_size * n_vertices;
3633  cellids_recv_buffers[i].resize(buffer_size);
3634 
3635  // Receive the message
3636  ierr = MPI_Recv(cellids_recv_buffers[i].data(),
3637  buffer_size,
3638  MPI_CHAR,
3639  source,
3640  mpi_tag2,
3641  triangulation.get_communicator(),
3642  MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
3643  AssertThrowMPI(ierr);
3644  }
3645 
3646 
3647  // Match the data received with the required vertices
3648  vert_to_recv_it = vertices_to_recv.begin();
3649  for (unsigned int i = 0; vert_to_recv_it != vert_to_recv_end;
3650  ++i, ++vert_to_recv_it)
3651  {
3652  for (unsigned int j = 0; j < vert_to_recv_it->second.size(); ++j)
3653  {
3654  const unsigned int local_pos_recv = vertices_recv_buffers[i][2 * j];
3655  const types::global_vertex_index global_id_recv =
3656  vertices_recv_buffers[i][2 * j + 1];
3657  const std::string cellid_recv(
3658  &cellids_recv_buffers[i][max_cellid_size * j],
3659  &cellids_recv_buffers[i][max_cellid_size * j] + max_cellid_size);
3660  bool found = false;
3661  typename std::set<active_cell_iterator>::iterator
3662  cell_set_it = missing_vert_cells.begin(),
3663  end_cell_set = missing_vert_cells.end();
3664  for (; (found == false) && (cell_set_it != end_cell_set);
3665  ++cell_set_it)
3666  {
3667  typename std::set<active_cell_iterator>::iterator
3668  candidate_cell =
3669  vertex_to_cell[(*cell_set_it)->vertex_index(i)].begin(),
3670  end_cell =
3671  vertex_to_cell[(*cell_set_it)->vertex_index(i)].end();
3672  for (; candidate_cell != end_cell; ++candidate_cell)
3673  {
3674  std::string current_cellid =
3675  (*candidate_cell)->id().to_string();
3676  current_cellid.resize(max_cellid_size, '-');
3677  if (current_cellid.compare(cellid_recv) == 0)
3678  {
3679  local_to_global_vertex_index
3680  [(*candidate_cell)->vertex_index(local_pos_recv)] =
3681  global_id_recv;
3682  found = true;
3683 
3684  break;
3685  }
3686  }
3687  }
3688  }
3689  }
3690 #endif
3691 
3692  return local_to_global_vertex_index;
3693  }
3694 
3695 
3696 
3697  template <int dim, int spacedim>
3698  void
3699  get_face_connectivity_of_cells(
3700  const Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation,
3701  DynamicSparsityPattern & cell_connectivity)
3702  {
3703  cell_connectivity.reinit(triangulation.n_active_cells(),
3704  triangulation.n_active_cells());
3705 
3706  // loop over all cells and their neighbors to build the sparsity
3707  // pattern. note that it's a bit hard to enter all the connections when a
3708  // neighbor has children since we would need to find out which of its
3709  // children is adjacent to the current cell. this problem can be omitted
3710  // if we only do something if the neighbor has no children -- in that case
3711  // it is either on the same or a coarser level than we are. in return, we
3712  // have to add entries in both directions for both cells
3713  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
3714  {
3715  const unsigned int index = cell->active_cell_index();
3716  cell_connectivity.add(index, index);
3717  for (auto f : cell->face_indices())
3718  if ((cell->at_boundary(f) == false) &&
3719  (cell->neighbor(f)->has_children() == false))
3720  {
3721  const unsigned int other_index =
3722  cell->neighbor(f)->active_cell_index();
3723  cell_connectivity.add(index, other_index);
3724  cell_connectivity.add(other_index, index);
3725  }
3726  }
3727  }
3728 
3729 
3730 
3731  template <int dim, int spacedim>
3732  void
3733  get_vertex_connectivity_of_cells(
3734  const Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation,
3735  DynamicSparsityPattern & cell_connectivity)
3736  {
3737  std::vector<std::vector<unsigned int>> vertex_to_cell(
3738  triangulation.n_vertices());
3739  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
3740  {
3741  for (const unsigned int v : cell->vertex_indices())
3742  vertex_to_cell[cell->vertex_index(v)].push_back(
3743  cell->active_cell_index());
3744  }
3745 
3746  cell_connectivity.reinit(triangulation.n_active_cells(),
3747  triangulation.n_active_cells());
3748  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
3749  {
3750  for (const unsigned int v : cell->vertex_indices())
3751  for (unsigned int n = 0;
3752  n < vertex_to_cell[cell->vertex_index(v)].size();
3753  ++n)
3754  cell_connectivity.add(cell->active_cell_index(),
3755  vertex_to_cell[cell->vertex_index(v)][n]);
3756  }
3757  }
3758 
3759 
3760  template <int dim, int spacedim>
3761  void
3762  get_vertex_connectivity_of_cells_on_level(
3763  const Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation,
3764  const unsigned int level,
3765  DynamicSparsityPattern & cell_connectivity)
3766  {
3767  std::vector<std::vector<unsigned int>> vertex_to_cell(
3768  triangulation.n_vertices());
3769  for (typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator cell =
3770  triangulation.begin(level);
3771  cell != triangulation.end(level);
3772  ++cell)
3773  {
3774  for (const unsigned int v : cell->vertex_indices())
3775  vertex_to_cell[cell->vertex_index(v)].push_back(cell->index());
3776  }
3777 
3778  cell_connectivity.reinit(triangulation.n_cells(level),
3779  triangulation.n_cells(level));
3780  for (typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator cell =
3781  triangulation.begin(level);
3782  cell != triangulation.end(level);
3783  ++cell)
3784  {
3785  for (const unsigned int v : cell->vertex_indices())
3786  for (unsigned int n = 0;
3787  n < vertex_to_cell[cell->vertex_index(v)].size();
3788  ++n)
3789  cell_connectivity.add(cell->index(),
3790  vertex_to_cell[cell->vertex_index(v)][n]);
3791  }
3792  }
3793 
3794 
3795 
3796  template <int dim, int spacedim>
3797  void
3798  partition_triangulation(const unsigned int n_partitions,
3799  Triangulation<dim, spacedim> & triangulation,
3800  const SparsityTools::Partitioner partitioner)
3801  {
3802  Assert((dynamic_cast<parallel::distributed::Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(
3803  &triangulation) == nullptr),
3804  ExcMessage("Objects of type parallel::distributed::Triangulation "
3805  "are already partitioned implicitly and can not be "
3806  "partitioned again explicitly."));
3807 
3808  std::vector<unsigned int> cell_weights;
3809 
3810  // Get cell weighting if a signal has been attached to the triangulation
3811  if (!triangulation.signals.cell_weight.empty())
3812  {
3813  cell_weights.resize(triangulation.n_active_cells(), 0U);
3814 
3815  // In a first step, obtain the weights of the locally owned
3816  // cells. For all others, the weight remains at the zero the
3817  // vector was initialized with above.
3818  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
3819  if (cell->is_locally_owned())
3820  cell_weights[cell->active_cell_index()] =
3821  triangulation.signals.cell_weight(
3822  cell, Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::CellStatus::CELL_PERSIST);
3823 
3824  // If this is a parallel triangulation, we then need to also
3825  // get the weights for all other cells. We have asserted above
3826  // that this function can't be used for
3827  // parallel::distribute::Triangulation objects, so the only
3828  // ones we have to worry about here are
3829  // parallel::shared::Triangulation
3830  if (const auto shared_tria =
3831  dynamic_cast<parallel::shared::Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(
3832  &triangulation))
3833  Utilities::MPI::sum(cell_weights,
3834  shared_tria->get_communicator(),
3835  cell_weights);
3836  }
3837 
3838  // Call the other more general function
3839  partition_triangulation(n_partitions,
3840  cell_weights,
3841  triangulation,
3842  partitioner);
3843  }
3844 
3845 
3846 
3847  template <int dim, int spacedim>
3848  void
3849  partition_triangulation(const unsigned int n_partitions,
3850  const std::vector<unsigned int> &cell_weights,
3851  Triangulation<dim, spacedim> & triangulation,
3852  const SparsityTools::Partitioner partitioner)
3853  {
3854  Assert((dynamic_cast<parallel::distributed::Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(
3855  &triangulation) == nullptr),
3856  ExcMessage("Objects of type parallel::distributed::Triangulation "
3857  "are already partitioned implicitly and can not be "
3858  "partitioned again explicitly."));
3859  Assert(n_partitions > 0, ExcInvalidNumberOfPartitions(n_partitions));
3860 
3861  // check for an easy return
3862  if (n_partitions == 1)
3863  {
3864  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
3865  cell->set_subdomain_id(0);
3866  return;
3867  }
3868 
3869  // we decompose the domain by first
3870  // generating the connection graph of all
3871  // cells with their neighbors, and then
3872  // passing this graph off to METIS.
3873  // finally defer to the other function for
3874  // partitioning and assigning subdomain ids
3875  DynamicSparsityPattern cell_connectivity;
3876  get_face_connectivity_of_cells(triangulation, cell_connectivity);
3877 
3878  SparsityPattern sp_cell_connectivity;
3879  sp_cell_connectivity.copy_from(cell_connectivity);
3880  partition_triangulation(n_partitions,
3881  cell_weights,
3882  sp_cell_connectivity,
3883  triangulation,
3884  partitioner);
3885  }
3886 
3887 
3888 
3889  template <int dim, int spacedim>
3890  void
3891  partition_triangulation(const unsigned int n_partitions,
3892  const SparsityPattern & cell_connection_graph,
3893  Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation,
3894  const SparsityTools::Partitioner partitioner)
3895  {
3896  Assert((dynamic_cast<parallel::distributed::Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(
3897  &triangulation) == nullptr),
3898  ExcMessage("Objects of type parallel::distributed::Triangulation "
3899  "are already partitioned implicitly and can not be "
3900  "partitioned again explicitly."));
3901 
3902  std::vector<unsigned int> cell_weights;
3903 
3904  // Get cell weighting if a signal has been attached to the triangulation
3905  if (!triangulation.signals.cell_weight.empty())
3906  {
3907  cell_weights.resize(triangulation.n_active_cells(), 0U);
3908 
3909  // In a first step, obtain the weights of the locally owned
3910  // cells. For all others, the weight remains at the zero the
3911  // vector was initialized with above.
3912  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
3913  if (cell->is_locally_owned())
3914  cell_weights[cell->active_cell_index()] =
3915  triangulation.signals.cell_weight(
3916  cell, Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::CellStatus::CELL_PERSIST);
3917 
3918  // If this is a parallel triangulation, we then need to also
3919  // get the weights for all other cells. We have asserted above
3920  // that this function can't be used for
3921  // parallel::distribute::Triangulation objects, so the only
3922  // ones we have to worry about here are
3923  // parallel::shared::Triangulation
3924  if (const auto shared_tria =
3925  dynamic_cast<parallel::shared::Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(
3926  &triangulation))
3927  Utilities::MPI::sum(cell_weights,
3928  shared_tria->get_communicator(),
3929  cell_weights);
3930  }
3931 
3932  // Call the other more general function
3933  partition_triangulation(n_partitions,
3934  cell_weights,
3935  cell_connection_graph,
3936  triangulation,
3937  partitioner);
3938  }
3939 
3940 
3941 
3942  template <int dim, int spacedim>
3943  void
3944  partition_triangulation(const unsigned int n_partitions,
3945  const std::vector<unsigned int> &cell_weights,
3946  const SparsityPattern & cell_connection_graph,
3947  Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation,
3948  const SparsityTools::Partitioner partitioner)
3949  {
3950  Assert((dynamic_cast<parallel::distributed::Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(
3951  &triangulation) == nullptr),
3952  ExcMessage("Objects of type parallel::distributed::Triangulation "
3953  "are already partitioned implicitly and can not be "
3954  "partitioned again explicitly."));
3955  Assert(n_partitions > 0, ExcInvalidNumberOfPartitions(n_partitions));
3956  Assert(cell_connection_graph.n_rows() == triangulation.n_active_cells(),
3957  ExcMessage("Connectivity graph has wrong size"));
3958  Assert(cell_connection_graph.n_cols() == triangulation.n_active_cells(),
3959  ExcMessage("Connectivity graph has wrong size"));
3960 
3961  // signal that partitioning is going to happen
3962  triangulation.signals.pre_partition();
3963 
3964  // check for an easy return
3965  if (n_partitions == 1)
3966  {
3967  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
3968  cell->set_subdomain_id(0);
3969  return;
3970  }
3971 
3972  // partition this connection graph and get
3973  // back a vector of indices, one per degree
3974  // of freedom (which is associated with a
3975  // cell)
3976  std::vector<unsigned int> partition_indices(triangulation.n_active_cells());
3977  SparsityTools::partition(cell_connection_graph,
3978  cell_weights,
3979  n_partitions,
3980  partition_indices,
3981  partitioner);
3982 
3983  // finally loop over all cells and set the subdomain ids
3984  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
3985  cell->set_subdomain_id(partition_indices[cell->active_cell_index()]);
3986  }
3987 
3988 
3989  namespace internal
3990  {
3994  template <class IT>
3995  void
3996  set_subdomain_id_in_zorder_recursively(IT cell,
3997  unsigned int & current_proc_idx,
3998  unsigned int & current_cell_idx,
3999  const unsigned int n_active_cells,
4000  const unsigned int n_partitions)
4001  {
4002  if (cell->is_active())
4003  {
4004  while (current_cell_idx >=
4005  std::floor(static_cast<uint_least64_t>(n_active_cells) *
4006  (current_proc_idx + 1) / n_partitions))
4007  ++current_proc_idx;
4008  cell->set_subdomain_id(current_proc_idx);
4009  ++current_cell_idx;
4010  }
4011  else
4012  {
4013  for (unsigned int n = 0; n < cell->n_children(); ++n)
4014  set_subdomain_id_in_zorder_recursively(cell->child(n),
4015  current_proc_idx,
4016  current_cell_idx,
4017  n_active_cells,
4018  n_partitions);
4019  }
4020  }
4021  } // namespace internal
4022 
4023  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4024  void
4025  partition_triangulation_zorder(const unsigned int n_partitions,
4026  Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation,
4027  const bool group_siblings)
4028  {
4029  Assert((dynamic_cast<parallel::distributed::Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(
4030  &triangulation) == nullptr),
4031  ExcMessage("Objects of type parallel::distributed::Triangulation "
4032  "are already partitioned implicitly and can not be "
4033  "partitioned again explicitly."));
4034  Assert(n_partitions > 0, ExcInvalidNumberOfPartitions(n_partitions));
4035 
4036  // signal that partitioning is going to happen
4037  triangulation.signals.pre_partition();
4038 
4039  // check for an easy return
4040  if (n_partitions == 1)
4041  {
4042  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
4043  cell->set_subdomain_id(0);
4044  return;
4045  }
4046 
4047  // Duplicate the coarse cell reordoring
4048  // as done in p4est
4049  std::vector<types::global_dof_index> coarse_cell_to_p4est_tree_permutation;
4050  std::vector<types::global_dof_index> p4est_tree_to_coarse_cell_permutation;
4051 
4052  DynamicSparsityPattern cell_connectivity;
4053  GridTools::get_vertex_connectivity_of_cells_on_level(triangulation,
4054  0,
4055  cell_connectivity);
4056  coarse_cell_to_p4est_tree_permutation.resize(triangulation.n_cells(0));
4057  SparsityTools::reorder_hierarchical(cell_connectivity,
4058  coarse_cell_to_p4est_tree_permutation);
4059 
4060  p4est_tree_to_coarse_cell_permutation =
4061  Utilities::invert_permutation(coarse_cell_to_p4est_tree_permutation);
4062 
4063  unsigned int current_proc_idx = 0;
4064  unsigned int current_cell_idx = 0;
4065  const unsigned int n_active_cells = triangulation.n_active_cells();
4066 
4067  // set subdomain id for active cell descendants
4068  // of each coarse cell in permuted order
4069  for (unsigned int idx = 0; idx < triangulation.n_cells(0); ++idx)
4070  {
4071  const unsigned int coarse_cell_idx =
4072  p4est_tree_to_coarse_cell_permutation[idx];
4073  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator coarse_cell(
4074  &triangulation, 0, coarse_cell_idx);
4075 
4076  internal::set_subdomain_id_in_zorder_recursively(coarse_cell,
4077  current_proc_idx,
4078  current_cell_idx,
4079  n_active_cells,
4080  n_partitions);
4081  }
4082 
4083  // if all children of a cell are active (e.g. we
4084  // have a cell that is refined once and no part
4085  // is refined further), p4est places all of them
4086  // on the same processor. The new owner will be
4087  // the processor with the largest number of children
4088  // (ties are broken by picking the lower rank).
4089  // Duplicate this logic here.
4090  if (group_siblings)
4091  {
4092  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator
4093  cell = triangulation.begin(),
4094  endc = triangulation.end();
4095  for (; cell != endc; ++cell)
4096  {
4097  if (cell->is_active())
4098  continue;
4099  bool all_children_active = true;
4100  std::map<unsigned int, unsigned int> map_cpu_n_cells;
4101  for (unsigned int n = 0; n < cell->n_children(); ++n)
4102  if (!cell->child(n)->is_active())
4103  {
4104  all_children_active = false;
4105  break;
4106  }
4107  else
4108  ++map_cpu_n_cells[cell->child(n)->subdomain_id()];
4109 
4110  if (!all_children_active)
4111  continue;
4112 
4113  unsigned int new_owner = cell->child(0)->subdomain_id();
4114  for (std::map<unsigned int, unsigned int>::iterator it =
4115  map_cpu_n_cells.begin();
4116  it != map_cpu_n_cells.end();
4117  ++it)
4118  if (it->second > map_cpu_n_cells[new_owner])
4119  new_owner = it->first;
4120 
4121  for (unsigned int n = 0; n < cell->n_children(); ++n)
4122  cell->child(n)->set_subdomain_id(new_owner);
4123  }
4124  }
4125  }
4126 
4127 
4128  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4129  void
4130  partition_multigrid_levels(Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation)
4131  {
4132  unsigned int n_levels = triangulation.n_levels();
4133  for (int lvl = n_levels - 1; lvl >= 0; --lvl)
4134  {
4135  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator
4136  cell = triangulation.begin(lvl),
4137  endc = triangulation.end(lvl);
4138  for (; cell != endc; ++cell)
4139  {
4140  if (cell->is_active())
4141  cell->set_level_subdomain_id(cell->subdomain_id());
4142  else
4143  {
4144  Assert(cell->child(0)->level_subdomain_id() !=
4145  numbers::artificial_subdomain_id,
4146  ExcInternalError());
4147  cell->set_level_subdomain_id(
4148  cell->child(0)->level_subdomain_id());
4149  }
4150  }
4151  }
4152  }
4153 
4154 
4155 
4156  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4157  std::vector<types::subdomain_id>
4158  get_subdomain_association(const Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation,
4159  const std::vector<CellId> & cell_ids)
4160  {
4161  std::vector<types::subdomain_id> subdomain_ids;
4162  subdomain_ids.reserve(cell_ids.size());
4163 
4164  if (dynamic_cast<
4165  const parallel::fullydistributed::Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(
4166  &triangulation) != nullptr)
4167  {
4168  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
4169  }
4170  else if (const parallel::distributed::Triangulation<dim, spacedim>
4171  *parallel_tria = dynamic_cast<
4172  const parallel::distributed::Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *>(
4173  &triangulation))
4174  {
4175 #ifndef DEAL_II_WITH_P4EST
4176  Assert(
4177  false,
4178  ExcMessage(
4179  "You are attempting to use a functionality that is only available "
4180  "if deal.II was configured to use p4est, but cmake did not find a "
4181  "valid p4est library."));
4182 #else
4183  // for parallel distributed triangulations, we will ask the p4est oracle
4184  // about the global partitioning of active cells since this information
4185  // is stored on every process
4186  for (const auto &cell_id : cell_ids)
4187  {
4188  // find descendent from coarse quadrant
4189  typename ::internal::p4est::types<dim>::quadrant p4est_cell,
4190  p4est_children[GeometryInfo<dim>::max_children_per_cell];
4191 
4192  ::internal::p4est::init_coarse_quadrant<dim>(p4est_cell);
4193  for (const auto &child_index : cell_id.get_child_indices())
4194  {
4195  ::internal::p4est::init_quadrant_children<dim>(
4196  p4est_cell, p4est_children);
4197  p4est_cell =
4198  p4est_children[static_cast<unsigned int>(child_index)];
4199  }
4200 
4201  // find owning process, i.e., the subdomain id
4202  const int owner =
4203  ::internal::p4est::functions<dim>::comm_find_owner(
4204  const_cast<typename ::internal::p4est::types<dim>::forest
4205  *>(parallel_tria->get_p4est()),
4206  cell_id.get_coarse_cell_id(),
4207  &p4est_cell,
4208  Utilities::MPI::this_mpi_process(
4209  parallel_tria->get_communicator()));
4210 
4211  Assert(owner >= 0, ExcMessage("p4est should know the owner."));
4212 
4213  subdomain_ids.push_back(owner);
4214  }
4215 #endif
4216  }
4217  else if (const parallel::shared::Triangulation<dim, spacedim> *shared_tria =
4218  dynamic_cast<const parallel::shared::Triangulation<dim, spacedim>
4219  *>(&triangulation))
4220  {
4221  // for parallel shared triangulations, we need to access true subdomain
4222  // ids which are also valid for artificial cells
4223  const std::vector<types::subdomain_id> &true_subdomain_ids_of_cells =
4224  shared_tria->get_true_subdomain_ids_of_cells();
4225 
4226  for (const auto &cell_id : cell_ids)
4227  {
4228  const unsigned int active_cell_index =
4229  shared_tria->create_cell_iterator(cell_id)->active_cell_index();
4230  subdomain_ids.push_back(
4231  true_subdomain_ids_of_cells[active_cell_index]);
4232  }
4233  }
4234  else
4235  {
4236  // the most general type of triangulation is the serial one. here, all
4237  // subdomain information is directly available
4238  for (const auto &cell_id : cell_ids)
4239  {
4240  subdomain_ids.push_back(
4241  triangulation.create_cell_iterator(cell_id)->subdomain_id());
4242  }
4243  }
4244 
4245  return subdomain_ids;
4246  }
4247 
4248 
4249 
4250  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4251  void
4252  get_subdomain_association(const Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation,
4253  std::vector<types::subdomain_id> & subdomain)
4254  {
4255  Assert(subdomain.size() == triangulation.n_active_cells(),
4256  ExcDimensionMismatch(subdomain.size(),
4257  triangulation.n_active_cells()));
4258  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
4259  subdomain[cell->active_cell_index()] = cell->subdomain_id();
4260  }
4261 
4262 
4263 
4264  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4265  unsigned int
4266  count_cells_with_subdomain_association(
4267  const Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation,
4268  const types::subdomain_id subdomain)
4269  {
4270  unsigned int count = 0;
4271  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
4272  if (cell->subdomain_id() == subdomain)
4273  ++count;
4274 
4275  return count;
4276  }
4277 
4278 
4279 
4280  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4281  std::vector<bool>
4282  get_locally_owned_vertices(const Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation)
4283  {
4284  // start with all vertices
4285  std::vector<bool> locally_owned_vertices =
4286  triangulation.get_used_vertices();
4287 
4288  // if the triangulation is distributed, eliminate those that
4289  // are owned by other processors -- either because the vertex is
4290  // on an artificial cell, or because it is on a ghost cell with
4291  // a smaller subdomain
4292  if (const auto *tr = dynamic_cast<
4293  const parallel::DistributedTriangulationBase<dim, spacedim> *>(
4294  &triangulation))
4295  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
4296  if (cell->is_artificial() ||
4297  (cell->is_ghost() &&
4298  (cell->subdomain_id() < tr->locally_owned_subdomain())))
4299  for (const unsigned int v : cell->vertex_indices())
4300  locally_owned_vertices[cell->vertex_index(v)] = false;
4301 
4302  return locally_owned_vertices;
4303  }
4304 
4305 
4306 
4307  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4308  double
4309  minimal_cell_diameter(const Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation,
4310  const Mapping<dim, spacedim> & mapping)
4311  {
4312  double min_diameter = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
4313  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
4314  if (!cell->is_artificial())
4315  min_diameter = std::min(min_diameter, cell->diameter(mapping));
4316 
4317  double global_min_diameter = 0;
4318 
4319 #ifdef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
4320  if (const parallel::TriangulationBase<dim, spacedim> *p_tria =
4321  dynamic_cast<const parallel::TriangulationBase<dim, spacedim> *>(
4322  &triangulation))
4323  global_min_diameter =
4324  Utilities::MPI::min(min_diameter, p_tria->get_communicator());
4325  else
4326 #endif
4327  global_min_diameter = min_diameter;
4328 
4329  return global_min_diameter;
4330  }
4331 
4332 
4333 
4334  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4335  double
4336  maximal_cell_diameter(const Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &triangulation,
4337  const Mapping<dim, spacedim> & mapping)
4338  {
4339  double max_diameter = 0.;
4340  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
4341  if (!cell->is_artificial())
4342  max_diameter = std::max(max_diameter, cell->diameter(mapping));
4343 
4344  double global_max_diameter = 0;
4345 
4346 #ifdef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
4347  if (const parallel::TriangulationBase<dim, spacedim> *p_tria =
4348  dynamic_cast<const parallel::TriangulationBase<dim, spacedim> *>(
4349  &triangulation))
4350  global_max_diameter =
4351  Utilities::MPI::max(max_diameter, p_tria->get_communicator());
4352  else
4353 #endif
4354  global_max_diameter = max_diameter;
4355 
4356  return global_max_diameter;
4357  }
4358 
4359 
4360 
4361  namespace internal
4362  {
4363  namespace FixUpDistortedChildCells
4364  {
4365  // compute the mean square
4366  // deviation of the alternating
4367  // forms of the children of the
4368  // given object from that of
4369  // the object itself. for
4370  // objects with
4371  // structdim==spacedim, the
4372  // alternating form is the
4373  // determinant of the jacobian,
4374  // whereas for faces with
4375  // structdim==spacedim-1, the
4376  // alternating form is the
4377  // (signed and scaled) normal
4378  // vector
4379  //
4380  // this average square
4381  // deviation is computed for an
4382  // object where the center node
4383  // has been replaced by the
4384  // second argument to this
4385  // function
4386  template <typename Iterator, int spacedim>
4387  double
4388  objective_function(const Iterator & object,
4389  const Point<spacedim> &object_mid_point)
4390  {
4391  const unsigned int structdim =
4392  Iterator::AccessorType::structure_dimension;
4393  Assert(spacedim == Iterator::AccessorType::dimension,
4394  ExcInternalError());
4395 
4396  // everything below is wrong
4397  // if not for the following
4398  // condition
4399  Assert(object->refinement_case() ==
4400  RefinementCase<structdim>::isotropic_refinement,
4401  ExcNotImplemented());
4402  // first calculate the
4403  // average alternating form
4404  // for the parent cell/face
4405  Point<spacedim>
4406  parent_vertices[GeometryInfo<structdim>::vertices_per_cell];
4407  Tensor<spacedim - structdim, spacedim>
4408  parent_alternating_forms[GeometryInfo<structdim>::vertices_per_cell];
4409 
4410  for (const unsigned int i : object->vertex_indices())
4411  parent_vertices[i] = object->vertex(i);
4412 
4413  GeometryInfo<structdim>::alternating_form_at_vertices(
4414  parent_vertices, parent_alternating_forms);
4415 
4416  const Tensor<spacedim - structdim, spacedim>
4417  average_parent_alternating_form =
4418  std::accumulate(parent_alternating_forms,
4419  parent_alternating_forms +
4420  GeometryInfo<structdim>::vertices_per_cell,
4421  Tensor<spacedim - structdim, spacedim>());
4422 
4423  // now do the same
4424  // computation for the
4425  // children where we use the
4426  // given location for the
4427  // object mid point instead of
4428  // the one the triangulation
4429  // currently reports
4430  Point<spacedim>
4431  child_vertices[GeometryInfo<structdim>::max_children_per_cell]
4432  [GeometryInfo<structdim>::vertices_per_cell];
4433  Tensor<spacedim - structdim, spacedim> child_alternating_forms
4434  [GeometryInfo<structdim>::max_children_per_cell]
4435  [GeometryInfo<structdim>::vertices_per_cell];
4436 
4437  for (unsigned int c = 0; c < object->n_children(); ++c)
4438  for (const unsigned int i : object->child(c)->vertex_indices())
4439  child_vertices[c][i] = object->child(c)->vertex(i);
4440 
4441  // replace mid-object
4442  // vertex. note that for
4443  // child i, the mid-object
4444  // vertex happens to have the
4445  // number
4446  // max_children_per_cell-i
4447  for (unsigned int c = 0; c < object->n_children(); ++c)
4448  child_vertices[c][GeometryInfo<structdim>::max_children_per_cell - c -
4449  1] = object_mid_point;
4450 
4451  for (unsigned int c = 0; c < object->n_children(); ++c)
4452  GeometryInfo<structdim>::alternating_form_at_vertices(
4453  child_vertices[c], child_alternating_forms[c]);
4454 
4455  // on a uniformly refined
4456  // hypercube object, the child
4457  // alternating forms should
4458  // all be smaller by a factor
4459  // of 2^structdim than the
4460  // ones of the parent. as a
4461  // consequence, we'll use the
4462  // squared deviation from
4463  // this ideal value as an
4464  // objective function
4465  double objective = 0;
4466  for (unsigned int c = 0; c < object->n_children(); ++c)
4467  for (const unsigned int i : object->child(c)->vertex_indices())
4468  objective +=
4469  (child_alternating_forms[c][i] -
4470  average_parent_alternating_form / std::pow(2., 1. * structdim))
4471  .norm_square();
4472 
4473  return objective;
4474  }
4475 
4476 
4482  template <typename Iterator>
4483  Point<Iterator::AccessorType::space_dimension>
4484  get_face_midpoint(const Iterator & object,
4485  const unsigned int f,
4486  std::integral_constant<int, 1>)
4487  {
4488  return object->vertex(f);
4489  }
4490 
4491 
4492 
4498  template <typename Iterator>
4499  Point<Iterator::AccessorType::space_dimension>
4500  get_face_midpoint(const Iterator & object,
4501  const unsigned int f,
4502  std::integral_constant<int, 2>)
4503  {
4504  return object->line(f)->center();
4505  }
4506 
4507 
4508 
4514  template <typename Iterator>
4515  Point<Iterator::AccessorType::space_dimension>
4516  get_face_midpoint(const Iterator & object,
4517  const unsigned int f,
4518  std::integral_constant<int, 3>)
4519  {
4520  return object->face(f)->center();
4521  }
4522 
4523 
4524 
4547  template <typename Iterator>
4548  double
4549  minimal_diameter(const Iterator &object)
4550  {
4551  const unsigned int structdim =
4552  Iterator::AccessorType::structure_dimension;
4553 
4554  double diameter = object->diameter();
4555  for (const unsigned int f : object->face_indices())
4556  for (unsigned int e = f + 1; e < object->n_faces(); ++e)
4557  diameter = std::min(
4558  diameter,
4559  get_face_midpoint(object,
4560  f,
4561  std::integral_constant<int, structdim>())
4562  .distance(get_face_midpoint(
4563  object, e, std::integral_constant<int, structdim>())));
4564 
4565  return diameter;
4566  }
4567 
4568 
4569 
4574  template <typename Iterator>
4575  bool
4576  fix_up_object(const Iterator &object)
4577  {
4578  const unsigned int structdim =
4579  Iterator::AccessorType::structure_dimension;
4580  const unsigned int spacedim = Iterator::AccessorType::space_dimension;
4581 
4582  // right now we can only deal with cells that have been refined
4583  // isotropically because that is the only case where we have a cell
4584  // mid-point that can be moved around without having to consider
4585  // boundary information
4586  Assert(object->has_children(), ExcInternalError());
4587  Assert(object->refinement_case() ==
4588  RefinementCase<structdim>::isotropic_refinement,
4589  ExcNotImplemented());
4590 
4591  // get the current location of the object mid-vertex:
4592  Point<spacedim> object_mid_point = object->child(0)->vertex(
4593  GeometryInfo<structdim>::max_children_per_cell - 1);
4594 
4595  // now do a few steepest descent steps to reduce the objective
4596  // function. compute the diameter in the helper function above
4597  unsigned int iteration = 0;
4598  const double diameter = minimal_diameter(object);
4599 
4600  // current value of objective function and initial delta
4601  double current_value = objective_function(object, object_mid_point);
4602  double initial_delta = 0;
4603 
4604  do
4605  {
4606  // choose a step length that is initially 1/4 of the child
4607  // objects' diameter, and a sequence whose sum does not converge
4608  // (to avoid premature termination of the iteration)
4609  const double step_length = diameter / 4 / (iteration + 1);
4610 
4611  // compute the objective function's derivative using a two-sided
4612  // difference formula with eps=step_length/10
4613  Tensor<1, spacedim> gradient;
4614  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < spacedim; ++d)
4615  {
4616  const double eps = step_length / 10;
4617 
4618  Tensor<1, spacedim> h;
4619  h[d] = eps / 2;
4620 
4621  gradient[d] =
4622  (objective_function(
4623  object, project_to_object(object, object_mid_point + h)) -
4624  objective_function(
4625  object, project_to_object(object, object_mid_point - h))) /
4626  eps;
4627  }
4628 
4629  // there is nowhere to go
4630  if (gradient.norm() == 0)
4631  break;
4632 
4633  // We need to go in direction -gradient. the optimal value of the
4634  // objective function is zero, so assuming that the model is
4635  // quadratic we would have to go -2*val/||gradient|| in this
4636  // direction, make sure we go at most step_length into this
4637  // direction
4638  object_mid_point -=
4639  std::min(2 * current_value / (gradient * gradient),
4640  step_length / gradient.norm()) *
4641  gradient;
4642  object_mid_point = project_to_object(object, object_mid_point);
4643 
4644  // compute current value of the objective function
4645  const double previous_value = current_value;
4646  current_value = objective_function(object, object_mid_point);
4647 
4648  if (iteration == 0)
4649  initial_delta = (previous_value - current_value);
4650 
4651  // stop if we aren't moving much any more
4652  if ((iteration >= 1) &&
4653  ((previous_value - current_value < 0) ||
4654  (std::fabs(previous_value - current_value) <
4655  0.001 * initial_delta)))
4656  break;
4657 
4658  ++iteration;
4659  }
4660  while (iteration < 20);
4661 
4662  // verify that the new
4663  // location is indeed better
4664  // than the one before. check
4665  // this by comparing whether
4666  // the minimum value of the
4667  // products of parent and
4668  // child alternating forms is
4669  // positive. for cells this
4670  // means that the
4671  // determinants have the same
4672  // sign, for faces that the
4673  // face normals of parent and
4674  // children point in the same
4675  // general direction
4676  double old_min_product, new_min_product;
4677 
4678  Point<spacedim>
4679  parent_vertices[GeometryInfo<structdim>::vertices_per_cell];
4680  for (const unsigned int i : GeometryInfo<structdim>::vertex_indices())
4681  parent_vertices[i] = object->vertex(i);
4682 
4683  Tensor<spacedim - structdim, spacedim>
4684  parent_alternating_forms[GeometryInfo<structdim>::vertices_per_cell];
4685  GeometryInfo<structdim>::alternating_form_at_vertices(
4686  parent_vertices, parent_alternating_forms);
4687 
4688  Point<spacedim>
4689  child_vertices[GeometryInfo<structdim>::max_children_per_cell]
4690  [GeometryInfo<structdim>::vertices_per_cell];
4691 
4692  for (unsigned int c = 0; c < object->n_children(); ++c)
4693  for (const unsigned int i : object->child(c)->vertex_indices())
4694  child_vertices[c][i] = object->child(c)->vertex(i);
4695 
4696  Tensor<spacedim - structdim, spacedim> child_alternating_forms
4697  [GeometryInfo<structdim>::max_children_per_cell]
4698  [GeometryInfo<structdim>::vertices_per_cell];
4699 
4700  for (unsigned int c = 0; c < object->n_children(); ++c)
4701  GeometryInfo<structdim>::alternating_form_at_vertices(
4702  child_vertices[c], child_alternating_forms[c]);
4703 
4704  old_min_product =
4705  child_alternating_forms[0][0] * parent_alternating_forms[0];
4706  for (unsigned int c = 0; c < object->n_children(); ++c)
4707  for (const unsigned int i : object->child(c)->vertex_indices())
4708  for (const unsigned int j : object->vertex_indices())
4709  old_min_product = std::min<double>(old_min_product,
4710  child_alternating_forms[c][i] *
4711  parent_alternating_forms[j]);
4712 
4713  // for the new minimum value,
4714  // replace mid-object
4715  // vertex. note that for child
4716  // i, the mid-object vertex
4717  // happens to have the number
4718  // max_children_per_cell-i
4719  for (unsigned int c = 0; c < object->n_children(); ++c)
4720  child_vertices[c][GeometryInfo<structdim>::max_children_per_cell - c -
4721  1] = object_mid_point;
4722 
4723  for (unsigned int c = 0; c < object->n_children(); ++c)
4724  GeometryInfo<structdim>::alternating_form_at_vertices(
4725  child_vertices[c], child_alternating_forms[c]);
4726 
4727  new_min_product =
4728  child_alternating_forms[0][0] * parent_alternating_forms[0];
4729  for (unsigned int c = 0; c < object->n_children(); ++c)
4730  for (const unsigned int i : object->child(c)->vertex_indices())
4731  for (const unsigned int j : object->vertex_indices())
4732  new_min_product = std::min<double>(new_min_product,
4733  child_alternating_forms[c][i] *
4734  parent_alternating_forms[j]);
4735 
4736  // if new minimum value is
4737  // better than before, then set the
4738  // new mid point. otherwise
4739  // return this object as one of
4740  // those that can't apparently
4741  // be fixed
4742  if (new_min_product >= old_min_product)
4743  object->child(0)->vertex(
4744  GeometryInfo<structdim>::max_children_per_cell - 1) =
4745  object_mid_point;
4746 
4747  // return whether after this
4748  // operation we have an object that
4749  // is well oriented
4750  return (std::max(new_min_product, old_min_product) > 0);
4751  }
4752 
4753 
4754 
4755  // possibly fix up the faces of a cell by moving around its mid-points
4756  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4757  void
4758  fix_up_faces(
4759  const typename ::Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator
4760  &cell,
4761  std::integral_constant<int, dim>,
4762  std::integral_constant<int, spacedim>)
4763  {
4764  // see if we first can fix up some of the faces of this object. We can
4765  // mess with faces if and only if the neighboring cell is not even
4766  // more refined than we are (since in that case the sub-faces have
4767  // themselves children that we can't move around any more). however,
4768  // the latter case shouldn't happen anyway: if the current face is
4769  // distorted but the neighbor is even more refined, then the face had
4770  // been deformed before already, and had been ignored at the time; we
4771  // should then also be able to ignore it this time as well
4772  for (auto f : cell->face_indices())
4773  {
4774  Assert(cell->face(f)->has_children(), ExcInternalError());
4775  Assert(cell->face(f)->refinement_case() ==
4776  RefinementCase<dim - 1>::isotropic_refinement,
4777  ExcInternalError());
4778 
4779  bool subface_is_more_refined = false;
4780  for (unsigned int g = 0;
4781  g < GeometryInfo<dim>::max_children_per_face;
4782  ++g)
4783  if (cell->face(f)->child(g)->has_children())
4784  {
4785  subface_is_more_refined = true;
4786  break;
4787  }
4788 
4789  if (subface_is_more_refined == true)
4790  continue;
4791 
4792  // we finally know that we can do something about this face
4793  fix_up_object(cell->face(f));
4794  }
4795  }
4796  } /* namespace FixUpDistortedChildCells */
4797  } /* namespace internal */
4798 
4799 
4800  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4801  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::DistortedCellList
4802  fix_up_distorted_child_cells(
4803  const typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::DistortedCellList
4804  &distorted_cells,
4805  Triangulation<dim, spacedim> & /*triangulation*/)
4806  {
4807  static_assert(
4808  dim != 1 && spacedim != 1,
4809  "This function is only valid when dim != 1 or spacedim != 1.");
4810  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::DistortedCellList unfixable_subset;
4811 
4812  // loop over all cells that we have to fix up
4813  for (typename std::list<
4814  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator>::const_iterator
4815  cell_ptr = distorted_cells.distorted_cells.begin();
4816  cell_ptr != distorted_cells.distorted_cells.end();
4817  ++cell_ptr)
4818  {
4819  const typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::cell_iterator cell =
4820  *cell_ptr;
4821 
4822  Assert(!cell->is_active(),
4823  ExcMessage(
4824  "This function is only valid for a list of cells that "
4825  "have children (i.e., no cell in the list may be active)."));
4826 
4827  internal::FixUpDistortedChildCells::fix_up_faces(
4828  cell,
4829  std::integral_constant<int, dim>(),
4830  std::integral_constant<int, spacedim>());
4831 
4832  // If possible, fix up the object.
4833  if (!internal::FixUpDistortedChildCells::fix_up_object(cell))
4834  unfixable_subset.distorted_cells.push_back(cell);
4835  }
4836 
4837  return unfixable_subset;
4838  }
4839 
4840 
4841 
4842  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4843  void
4844  copy_boundary_to_manifold_id(Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &tria,
4845  const bool reset_boundary_ids)
4846  {
4847  const auto src_boundary_ids = tria.get_boundary_ids();
4848  std::vector<types::manifold_id> dst_manifold_ids(src_boundary_ids.size());
4849  auto m_it = dst_manifold_ids.begin();
4850  for (const auto b : src_boundary_ids)
4851  {
4852  *m_it = static_cast<types::manifold_id>(b);
4853  ++m_it;
4854  }
4855  const std::vector<types::boundary_id> reset_boundary_id =
4856  reset_boundary_ids ?
4857  std::vector<types::boundary_id>(src_boundary_ids.size(), 0) :
4858  src_boundary_ids;
4859  map_boundary_to_manifold_ids(src_boundary_ids,
4860  dst_manifold_ids,
4861  tria,
4862  reset_boundary_id);
4863  }
4864 
4865 
4866 
4867  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4868  void
4869  map_boundary_to_manifold_ids(
4870  const std::vector<types::boundary_id> &src_boundary_ids,
4871  const std::vector<types::manifold_id> &dst_manifold_ids,
4872  Triangulation<dim, spacedim> & tria,
4873  const std::vector<types::boundary_id> &reset_boundary_ids_)
4874  {
4875  AssertDimension(src_boundary_ids.size(), dst_manifold_ids.size());
4876  const auto reset_boundary_ids =
4877  reset_boundary_ids_.size() ? reset_boundary_ids_ : src_boundary_ids;
4878  AssertDimension(reset_boundary_ids.size(), src_boundary_ids.size());
4879 
4880  // in 3d, we not only have to copy boundary ids of faces, but also of edges
4881  // because we see them twice (once from each adjacent boundary face),
4882  // we cannot immediately reset their boundary ids. thus, copy first
4883  // and reset later
4884  if (dim >= 3)
4885  for (const auto &cell : tria.active_cell_iterators())
4886  for (auto f : cell->face_indices())
4887  if (cell->face(f)->at_boundary())
4888  for (unsigned int e = 0; e < cell->face(f)->n_lines(); ++e)
4889  {
4890  const auto bid = cell->face(f)->line(e)->boundary_id();
4891  const unsigned int ind = std::find(src_boundary_ids.begin(),
4892  src_boundary_ids.end(),
4893  bid) -
4894  src_boundary_ids.begin();
4895  if (ind < src_boundary_ids.size())
4896  cell->face(f)->line(e)->set_manifold_id(
4897  dst_manifold_ids[ind]);
4898  }
4899 
4900  // now do cells
4901  for (const auto &cell : tria.active_cell_iterators())
4902  for (auto f : cell->face_indices())
4903  if (cell->face(f)->at_boundary())
4904  {
4905  const auto bid = cell->face(f)->boundary_id();
4906  const unsigned int ind =
4907  std::find(src_boundary_ids.begin(), src_boundary_ids.end(), bid) -
4908  src_boundary_ids.begin();
4909 
4910  if (ind < src_boundary_ids.size())
4911  {
4912  // assign the manifold id
4913  cell->face(f)->set_manifold_id(dst_manifold_ids[ind]);
4914  // then reset boundary id
4915  cell->face(f)->set_boundary_id(reset_boundary_ids[ind]);
4916  }
4917 
4918  if (dim >= 3)
4919  for (unsigned int e = 0; e < cell->face(f)->n_lines(); ++e)
4920  {
4921  const auto bid = cell->face(f)->line(e)->boundary_id();
4922  const unsigned int ind = std::find(src_boundary_ids.begin(),
4923  src_boundary_ids.end(),
4924  bid) -
4925  src_boundary_ids.begin();
4926  if (ind < src_boundary_ids.size())
4927  cell->face(f)->line(e)->set_boundary_id(
4928  reset_boundary_ids[ind]);
4929  }
4930  }
4931  }
4932 
4933 
4934  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4935  void
4936  copy_material_to_manifold_id(Triangulation<dim, spacedim> &tria,
4937  const bool compute_face_ids)
4938  {
4939  typename Triangulation<dim, spacedim>::active_cell_iterator
4940  cell = tria.begin_active(),
4941  endc = tria.end();
4942 
4943  for (; cell != endc; ++cell)
4944  {
4945  cell->set_manifold_id(cell->material_id());
4946  if (compute_face_ids == true)
4947  {
4948  for (auto f : cell->face_indices())
4949  {
4950  if (cell->at_boundary(f) == false)
4951  cell->face(f)->set_manifold_id(
4952  std::min(cell->material_id(),
4953  cell->neighbor(f)->material_id()));
4954  else
4955  cell->face(f)->set_manifold_id(cell->material_id());
4956  }
4957  }
4958  }
4959  }
4960 
4961 
4962  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4963  void
4964  assign_co_dimensional_manifold_indicators(
